title: MinoRaiola
author: MinoRaiola
content: I have been active in the German Local since the beginning and I thought it would be useful to inform here. If someone lost his MIOTA in 2018, they now have a chance to get it back. After all these years, I help some users and maybe there is someone too. I have all the contacts, you are welcome to write me. German Posting in 2019 = https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5136023QuoteGood morning, I am writing with an update regarding the trial of Wybo WEIRSMA which started yesterday (25th January) at Oxford Crown Court. I am delighted to be able to tell you that this morning (26th January) the second day of the trial WIERSMA has pleaded guilty to the theft of the IOTA cryptocurrency.  He will be sentenced by the Judge tomorrow (27th January).  I am sure you will be delighted by this news, which brings to an end nearly six years since the theft and the long and complex investigation. I cannot estimate what the Judge will consider is an appropriate sentence.  The Judge will take into account that WIERSMA has been in custody (Prison) in Holland & the UK since 24th December 2020.The next stage of the process will be working with you to return the seized cryptocurrency which is currently in the possession of the Police.  As I have said many times we were only able to seize a small amount of cryptocurrency that was in the Bitfinex exchange.  If I could ask you to bear with me for a few more days in order to be able deal with the final admin bits for the court case. Kind regardsSEROCU & Thames Valley Police Cyber Crime & Cryptocurrency Unit and DICE: South East.Source: https://www.thamesvalley.police.uk/

comments.author: MinoRaiola
comments.body: News from Germany. There is about 3 million fund available to be distributed to victims worldwide. A concept when this will happen is currently being developed by the British police. I think this is positive and I will inform here as soon as I know something new. The source of the information is a German police.

comments.author: sujonali1819
comments.body: It's nice that investors are getting back the coins after around 5years. But I can not understand how they will be paid and what will be processed if I were also a victim? Though the news is very surprising but I'm not sure how good the ending will be. Let's see and spread the news, maybe someone will be helped.

comments.author: MinoRaiola
comments.created_time: February 24, 2023, 05:43:40 PMLast edit: February 25, 2023, 09:23:16 AM by MinoRaiola
comments.body: Quote from: sujonali1819 on February 24, 2023, 03:40:15 PMIt's nice that investors are getting back the coins after around 5years. But I can not understand how they will be paid and what will be processed if I were also a victim? Though the news is very surprising but I'm not sure how good the ending will be. Let's see and spread the news, maybe someone will be helped. I am also happy to answer questions or give advice on where to contact me. I have been doing this for over 5 years and there have been many contacts and users that I have spoken to. I also have contact with the police, where the coins are located. I have some more information in the German thread, if anyone wants to try it themselve. Oxford Student Goes to Prison for Stealing $2.6M Via a Crypto ScamSource: https://cryptopotato.com/oxford-student-goes-to-prison-for-stealing-2-6m-via-a-crypto-scam/And here is a picture of him:Pictured: Oxford student who stole more than £2million from 100 victims across the world in sophisticated cryptocurrency scamhttps://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-11694635/Oxford-student-stole-2million-worth-cryptocurrency-jailed-four-years.html
